meanings.definition: To apply a new coat of lacquer to (something).
meanings.sent1: She relacquers the wooden table to make it shiny again.
meanings.sent2: He relacquers his guitar every year to keep it looking new.
meanings.sent3: The painter relacquers the chair, making it sparkle like a diamond.
meanings.sent4: The sun relacquers the sky with vibrant colors at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The gardener relacquers the fence, transforming it into a glossy barrier.

meanings.definition: The act of applying a new coat of lacquer to (something).
meanings.sent1: The relacquers of the furniture give it a fresh and polished look.
meanings.sent2: After the relacquers, the wooden surface gleamed under the light.
meanings.sent3: The relacquers of the antique vase made it stand out in the room.
meanings.sent4: The relacquers of the stage set added a professional touch to the play.
meanings.sent5: The relacquers of the sculpture brought out its intricate details beautifully.
